snippet.title: 'The Goonies' director says sequel in the works
snippet.description: Fans of "The Goonies" have been holding out hopes for a sequel for nearly three decades. It could finally happen.

snippet.title: HTC One M8
snippet.description: Elegant style, raw power, and sophisticated features make the HTC One M8 an excellent smartphone choice for anyone but the most exacting photographer.

snippet.title: Samsung's smartwatch sequel: The Gear 2
snippet.description: At MWC in Barcelona, Spain, Samsung announces its second-generation Gear 2 smartwatch. The new device features the company's home-brewed Tizen OS, an integrated heart rate monitor, and water- and dust-resistant tech.

snippet.title: The 404 1,468: Where we never asked for that sequel
snippet.description: Scott Stein helps Jeff talk about the most unwanted sequels of all time (we're looking at you Mrs. Doubtfire 2), plus Google's attempt to kill the vertical video, and deciding which is the best portable console for you.

snippet.title: Borderlands: The Pre-Sequel takes players to the moon
snippet.description: A "sandwich sequel," if you will, Borderlands: The Pre-Sequel takes place between Borderlands and Borderlands 2 and will take players off Pandora for the first time in the franchise's history.

snippet.title: Sphero 2B
snippet.description: Hands-on with the Sphero 2B phone-controlled robot, which features customisable tyres.

snippet.title: The 404 1,468: Where we never asked for that sequel (podcast)
snippet.description: Scott Stein helps Jeff talk about the most unwanted sequels of all time (we're looking at you Mrs. Doubtfire 2), plus Google's attempt to kill the vertical video, and deciding which is the best portable console for you.

snippet.title: Marvelous multitasking gadgets, the sequel (pictures)
snippet.description: A dress that flies, a road that charges electric buses. Part two of Crave's series on multitasking gear digs up more examples of design versatility -- some practical, and some all-out weird.

snippet.title: Where's My Water 2 for iOS
snippet.description: Where's My Water 2 is a fun sequel that is sadly overshadowed by a brutal freemium model that makes it impossible for me to recommend it to anyone.

snippet.title: Tesco Hudl tablet to get a supermarket sequel in 2014
snippet.description: The Tesco Hudl is an affordable 7-inch tablet that you can pop in your trolley on your next big shop for less than Â£100.
